jar.translation[0].definitions[0].defini: a glass container with a wide top and a lid, used for storing food such as jam or honey, or the amount it contains
jar.translation[0].definitions[0].exampl: half a jar of peanut butter
jar.translation[0].definitions[1].defini: a container made of clay, stone etc, used especially in the past for keeping food or drink in
jar.translation[0].definitions[2].exampl: Weâ€™d had a few jars down the pub.
jar.translation[1].definitions[0].defini: to make someone feel annoyed or shocked
jar.translation[1].definitions[0].exampl: The screaming was starting to jar on my nerves.
jar.translation[1].definitions[1].defini: to shake or hit something in a way that damages it or makes it loose
jar.translation[1].definitions[1].exampl: Alice landed badly, jarring her ankle.
jar.translation[1].definitions[2].defini: to be different in style or appearance from something else and therefore look strange
jar.translation[1].definitions[2].exampl: There was a modern lamp that jarred with the rest of the room.
